overview: David Robb has enjoyed a successful career spanning more than 20 years in CEO, chairman and founder roles for startups in marketing, graphics and digital media. Robb is the founder of DIY Media and serves as its CEO and Chairman. Prior to DIY Media, Robb was a Board member and Director of Marketing for Multimedia Design Corporation and before that served as the Director of Marketing for 58k.com, a reverse auction site for the graphic arts sector. Among his responsibilities there were software architecture, business development and securing venture capital financing. 58k.com was successfully sold to another VC-backed venture. Davidâ€™s first start-up was in the graphic arts when he started a specialty print, finishing and bindery company in Charlotte, NC. He began his career in the financial services, first at First Chicago Investment Advisors as an economist and then at The Chicago Corporation as a futures broker and trader. David holds an MA in Economics from Duke University and a BA in Business Management from North Carolina State University. He lives in Charlotte, with his wife and children. He is active in a number of civic capacities including the North Carolina Zoological Society, Humane Society Legislative Fund, and manages a youth cycling program, DIY Music Racing.
